private_information: My stack top->bottom is: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H (A is smallest, H is largest).
I can only move the top disk I hold, one disk at a time.
left_peg.goal: Help move all disks so that the right peg ends up with (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

private_information: I can receive or give the top disk only and must respect the rule: never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
middle_peg.goal: Assist in intermediate moves so that the right peg ends up with (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

private_information: I can receive or give the top disk only and must respect the rule: never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
right_peg.goal: Receive all disks in the correct order so that my final stack is (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a single PDDL domain and problem pair that fully encodes the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and is suitable to solve with the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; left and middle pegs empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg in an 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a clear, structured description of your local state (which disks you hold from top to bottom), which single-disk moves are legal from your peg to each other peg given the public rules, and any constraints you observe locally. Do NOT emit PDDL. Focus on exact local facts and allowed immediate actions.

You are the agent representing the middle peg in an 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a clear, structured description of your local state (which disks you hold from top to bottom), which single-disk moves are legal from your peg to each other peg given the public rules, and any constraints you observe locally. Do NOT emit PDDL. Focus on exact local facts and allowed immediate actions.

You are the agent representing the right peg in an 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a clear, structured description of your local state (which disks you hold from top to bottom), which single-disk moves are legal from your peg to each other peg given the public rules, and any constraints you observe locally. Do NOT emit PDDL. Focus on exact local facts and allowed immediate actions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for producing a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding of the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Use the public information about pegs, disk labels, initial and goal configurations, and the local states reported by the peg agents. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that: models disks and pegs, enforces the one-disk-at-a-time and size constraints (no larger on smaller), defines move actions that keep agent actions distinct if relevant, and encodes the given initial and goal configurations exactly. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards (STRIPS/ADL constructs commonly accepted by FastDownwards are acceptable).
